doc.description: A class for dealing with directories (folders)

name: bbn\file\dir

clean.name: clean
clean.summary: Replaces backslash with slash and deletes whitespace from the beginning and the end of a directory's path.

has_file.name: has_file
has_file.summary: Checks if the given file(s) exists in the directory.

cur.name: cur
cur.summary: If the directory's path starts with './' returns the path without './' else returns the complete path.

get_dirs.name: get_dirs
get_dirs.summary: Return an array of directories contained in the given directory.
get_dirs.description: It will return directories' full path.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: If true return the hidden directories' path

get_files.name: get_files
get_files.summary: Returns an array of files contained in the given directory.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: dirs If set to true it will also returns the folders contained in the given directory.

arguments.name: including_dirs
arguments.description: If set to true will also returns the hidden files contained the directory

delete.name: delete
delete.summary: Deletes the given directory and all its content.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: If set to '0' will delete only the content of the directory. Default: "1".

scan.name: scan
scan.summary: Returns an array with all the content of the given directory.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: The type or the extension of item to return ('file', 'dir', 'php', default is both)

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: If set to true will include the hidden files/directories in the result

mscan.name: mscan
mscan.summary: Returns an array of indexed arrays with the 'name' of the file/folder contained in the given directory, the 'mtime', and the 'date' of creation the file/folder.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: The type or the extension of item to return ('file', 'dir', 'php', default is both)

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: If set to true will also return the hidden files/folders contained in the given directory. Default=false

get_tree.name: get_tree
get_tree.summary: Return an array with the tree of the folder's content.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: dir If set to true will just return the folder(s), if false will include in the resulr also the file(s). Default = false.

arguments.name: filter
arguments.description: If set to true will also return the hidden file(s)/folder(s)

create_path.name: create_path
create_path.summary: Creates a folder with the given path.

arguments.name: dir
arguments.description: If set to true the user won't have the permissions to view the content of the folder created

move.name: move
move.summary: Moves a file or directory to a new location

arguments.name: orig
arguments.description: The full name of the destination (including basename)

arguments.name: dest
arguments.description: If in the destination folder alredy exists a file with the same name of the file to move it will rename the file adding '_v' (default). If 'string' will change the file name with the given string. If $st=true it will overwrite the file/folder.

arguments.name: st
arguments.description: The number of characters to use for the revision number; will be zerofilled

copy.name: copy
copy.summary: Will move the content of the given folder to a new destination. Doesn't move the hidden files.

test.name: test
test.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

parent.name: test
parent.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

check.name: check
check.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

parent.name: check
parent.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).
